segment_title: What are the signs of poor cardiovascular health I should watch for?
summary: Signs of poor cardiovascular health include:chest pain, shortness of breath, dizziness or lightheadedness, fatigue, swelling in the legs or ankles, irregular heartbeat (palpitations), unexplained sweating, nausea, pain in the jaw or arm, and fainting or near-fainting episodes;if you experience any of these, consult a healthcare professional.Heart disease - Symptoms and causes - Mayo ClinicAug 13, 2024 — Chest pain or discomfort. segment_title: Can regular exercise improve heart health, and what types are most beneficial?
